intro: Euphrasia × condensata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a hybrid plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces clusters of yellowish-orange flowers in the spring. Euphrasia × condensata has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
